laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: GH response during insulin tolerance testing

laboratory_examinations.findings: Prepubertal basal serum LH and FSH levels (1.2 and 1.6 IU/liter respectively).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: LH showed a 2-fold increase with no increase in FSH levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Even lower serum testosterone levels of 3.5 nmol/liter; blunted LH and FSH peak levels in response to GnRH.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum testosterone levels progressively fell to the peripubertal range.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Prolonged TSH response with TSH at 60 min: 9.8 mU/liter.
Patient attained Tanner pubertal development G4P4 with testicular volumes of approximately 7.5 ml, height 164 cm. Normal PRL levels.
Decreased volume of anterior pituitary lobe (height, 2.0 mm; normal, 4 â€“8 mm), no abnormalities in pituitary stalk or optic chiasm.
